article_title: How to cut America’s crazy high health care costs
article_text:
Thank you for your interest in licensing Fortune content. Please find information on various licensing contacts below and choose the one that best suits your needs:

1. To license Fortune articles, excerpts, or headlines for republication in various media (including books, eBooks, film, web, newsletters, newspapers, magazines and others), please email syndication@timeinc.com.

2. To license a Fortune cover, order reprint or e-print copies of an article or cover, or license an accolade, please contact PARS International at www.timeincreprints.com.

3. To license text only photocopies of Fortunearticles as print or digital handouts in academic settings, or in academic coursepacks, please contact the Copyright Clearance Center at www.copyright.com

twitter.description: After decades of false starts and frustration, free market champions should be cheering— competitive marketplaces work in health care. And no matter what your opinion of Obamacare, you have got t...
twitter.title: How to cut America’s crazy high health care costs

article_metadata.keywords: commentary, medicare part c, medicare part d, medicare, obamacare, affordable care act, george w. bush, congressional budget office
article_metadata.sailthru.tags: Affordable Care Act, Commentary, Congressional Budget Office, George W. Bush, Medicare, Medicare Part C, Medicare Part D, Obamacare
article_metadata.description: By creating more competitive markets for health insurance exchanges, Medicare Part C and other health services, the nation can save big, says Ezekiel J. Emanuel, chair of the Department of Medical Ethics and Health Policy at the University of Pennsylvania.
article_metadata.sailthru.title: How to cut America’s crazy high health care costs
